intro: Saurauia bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in montane forests and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture. Saurauia bulusanensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
